metadata.title: 5 Things To Know: June 6, 2025
metadata.description: CNBC’s Joe Kernen reports on the 5 things to know on June 6, 2025.

transcript.full_text: Five things to know ahead of the opening bell today. It's jobs Friday. Number one, pulled forecaster expect an increase of 125,000 non-farm payrolls in May. The unemployment rate is expected to hold steady. Remember ADP on Friday, it's not the same thing, not necessarily indicative, maybe even jobs claim, jobless claims might be more of jolts or something, but that was a little bit weak. This was unbelievable yesterday. I wondered, didn't you, about circle shares of stablecoin company circle sharply higher in pre-market trading after a big move yesterday. I think it was priced at like 31, stock opened at 69. Uh, and today it's all the way up to 94. Uh, up another 13%, and the shares of Lulu Lemon. I wanted uh to lead with that this morning. I I suggested that this would I I I did a double take when I saw this. No, I mean the top of the show. Oh, Lulu Lemon? Yeah, kidding. there's some other stuff, right? A couple other things Yeah, interceded in President Xi didn't even get top. Yeah, President Xi didn't even get uh uh what she said. Uh didn't even get Uh Plum earnings and revenue, uh and the other guys He. Huh. He and she, right? Huh and she. Huh, he, yeah. Revenue beat estimates but comps uh sales growth of 1% missed estimates of 3%. The company cut its full year uh guidance citing a dynamic macro environment. The CFO said they're planning strategic price increases to mitigate uh the effects of tariffs. And then you got the shares of DocuSign sharply lower. Earnings and revenue beat estimates, but billings in the first quarter uh came in weaker than expected. Um, the guidance That's a big move too. Yeah, the company's guidance for billing in the current quarter also came in below estimates. Broadcom earnings and revenue came in slightly higher than analysts expected and current quarter guidance also beat estimates on strong AI uh revenue growth. Uh, but the stock's pulling back a bit after a strong run up since the recent uh low hit in early April, just after President Trump announced uh the sweeping tariff plan. Stock's up about 70% from the April. There were some concerns from the Broadcom call yesterday that maybe all of this AI growth is not going to be quite as strong as had been hoped for, had been anticipated. That's what they said.

analysis.summary:
Today's pre-opening market analysis highlights key economic data and corporate earnings. On Jobs Friday, forecasters anticipate a 125,000 increase in non-farm payrolls for May, with the unemployment rate expected to hold steady. This follows earlier weak indicators from ADP, jobless claims, and JOLTS data, setting a cautious tone for the labor market report.

Company-specific news reveals significant stock movements. Circle, a stablecoin company, saw its shares surge dramatically in pre-market trading, climbing to $94 after opening at $69, marking a 13% increase today. In contrast, Lulu Lemon's shares faced pressure despite revenue beating estimates, as its 1% comparable sales growth missed the 3% target. The company subsequently cut its full-year guidance, attributing the revision to a dynamic macro environment, and indicated plans for strategic price increases to offset tariff impacts.

DocuSign also experienced a sharp decline in its shares, as weaker-than-expected first-quarter billings and below-estimate current quarter guidance overshadowed stronger earnings and revenue. Conversely, Broadcom delivered positive news with earnings and revenue slightly exceeding analyst expectations and robust current quarter guidance driven by strong AI revenue growth. However, Broadcom's stock is pulling back after a substantial 70% rally since early April, a period that began after President Trump announced a sweeping tariff plan. Concerns were also voiced during Broadcom's recent earnings call regarding the sustainability of AI growth expectations.

key_points.text: Forecasters expect an increase of 125,000 non-farm payrolls in May.
The unemployment rate is expected to hold steady.
Previous ADP, jobless claims, and JOLTS data were noted as weak.
Shares of stablecoin company Circle rose sharply in pre-market trading after a significant move yesterday.
Circle's stock opened at $69, rose to $94, and was up another 13% today.
Lulu Lemon's revenue beat estimates, but comparable sales growth of 1% missed estimates of 3%.
Lulu Lemon cut its full-year guidance, citing a dynamic macro environment.
Lulu Lemon's CFO announced plans for strategic price increases to mitigate the effects of tariffs.
DocuSign's earnings and revenue beat estimates, but first-quarter billings were weaker than expected.
DocuSign's guidance for billings in the current quarter also came in below estimates.
Broadcom's earnings and revenue were slightly higher than analysts expected.
Broadcom's current quarter guidance also beat estimates due to strong AI revenue growth.
Broadcom's stock is pulling back after a strong run-up since a low hit in early April.
The early April low for Broadcom's stock occurred just after President Trump announced a sweeping tariff plan.
Broadcom's stock is up about 70% from its April low.
Concerns were raised during the Broadcom earnings call yesterday that AI growth might not be as strong as anticipated.

timeline_events.event_description: Opening bell today for the stock market, identified as 'jobs Friday'.
Pulled forecasters expect an increase of 125,000 non-farm payrolls in May.
Circle shares were sharply higher in pre-market trading, reaching $94.
Circle shares made a 'big move yesterday', with the stock opening at $69.
Lulu Lemon cut its full year guidance, citing a dynamic macro environment.
DocuSign's billings in the first quarter came in weaker than expected.
DocuSign's guidance for billing in the current quarter also came in below estimates.
Broadcom's stock hit a recent low.
President Trump announced a sweeping tariff plan.
Concerns were raised during the Broadcom call yesterday regarding AI growth strength.

temporal_patterns.description: The current day is identified as 'jobs Friday', implying a recurring weekly event related to job market reports.
Circle shares show a progression in price: a 'big move yesterday' (stock opened at $69) followed by a further increase 'today' to $94, up another 13%.
DocuSign's financial performance shows a pattern of decline: Q1 billings were 'weaker than expected', and guidance for the 'current quarter also came in below estimates'.
Broadcom's stock price experienced a progression: hitting a 'recent low hit in early April', followed by a 'strong run up' (up about 70% from April), and then 'pulling back a bit' recently.

dates.context: guidance for billing in the current quarter
